edu.columbia.stat.wood.pub.sequencememoizer
Class IntSequenceMemoizer

java.lang.Object
  edu.columbia.stat.wood.pub.sequencememoizer.IntSequenceMemoizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IntSequenceMemoizerInterface, java.io.Serializable
public class IntSequenceMemoizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IntSequenceMemoizerInterface, java.io.Serializable

Implementation of a sequence memoizer which takes int types.

Author:
nicholasbartlett

IntSequenceMemoizer

public IntSequenceMemoizer()
Null constructor which uses all the default parameters and an alphabet size of 256.

Method Detail

newSequence

public void newSequence()
Indicates to the model that you wish to start a new sequence. The first time continueSequence is used after this the assumption is that the type is being seen with empty context.

Specified by:
newSequence in interface IntSequenceMemoizerInterface

continueSequence

public double continueSequence(int type)
Continue the current sequence by incorporating the new observation.

Specified by:
continueSequence in interface IntSequenceMemoizerInterface
Returns:
log predictive probability of observation prior to incorporating the observation into the model

continueSequence

public double continueSequence(int[] types)
Continue the sequence with the sequence of observations supplied. This is the same as looping over the method call continueSequence for each observation.

Specified by:
continueSequence in interface IntSequenceMemoizerInterface
Returns:
the sum of the log predictive probabilities of each observation prior to incorporating it into the model

generate

public int[] generate(int[] context,
                      int numSamples)
Generate some number of samples given a specified context.

Specified by:
generate in interface IntSequenceMemoizerInterface
Parameters:
context - context, arranged most distant to the left, most recent to the right
numSamples - number of samples desired
Returns:
samples from the predictive distribution in the specified context

                                  int[] sequence)
Gets the log probability of a sequence given the current state of the model.

Parameters:

Returns:

sample

public double sample(int numSweeps)
Sample the parameters in the model. The seating arrangements are sampled using Gibbs sampling while the discount parameters use a Gibbs-Metropolis step.

Specified by:
sample in interface IntSequenceMemoizerInterface
Parameters:
numSweeps - number of sweeps for the Gibbs sampler
Returns:
joint log probability of model and data

sampleSeatingArrangements
